data.title: Issues embedding LwjglAWTCanvas in swing on certain system(s)
data.body:
**Issue**

Upon embedding a `LwjglAWTCanvas` into swing, I am met with error output as shown at the bottom of this post. The same code can be run on my macbook (El Capitan, LibGDX: 1.7.0) without issue. Additionally, `LwjglApplication` and `LwjglCanvas` seem to work normally.

**System Specifications:**
- OS
  - Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 
  - Version: 10.0.10240 Build 10240
- GPU
  - AMD Radeon (TM) R9 390 Series
  - Driver: Catalyst 15.7 9.14.10.01128
  - API Support: OpenGL 4.5, OpenCl 2.0, DirectX 12, Mantle, Vulkan
- LibGDX
  - Version 1.7.0

**Sample Code:**

``` java
public class DesktopLauncher extends JFrame {

    private LwjglAWTCanvas canvas;

    public DesktopLauncher() {
        setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE);

        canvas = new LwjglAWTCanvas(new TestGame());
        canvas.getCanvas().setSize(500, 500);
        add(canvas.getCanvas());

        pack();
        setVisible(true);
    }

    public static void main (String[] arg) {
        SwingUtilities.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
            public void run() {
                new DesktopLauncher();
            }
        });
    }

    @Override
    public void dispose() {
        canvas.stop();

        super.dispose();
    }
}
```

**Crash Error Output:**

``` Java
Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: OpenGL 2.0 or higher with the FBO extension is required. OpenGL version: 4.5.13399 Compatibility Profile Context 15.200.1062.1004
ATI Technologies Inc.
AMD Radeon (TM) R9 390 Series
4.5.13399 Compatibility Profile Context 15.200.1062.1004

```

**Additional Information**

Upon adding the following line to the create void in `LwjglAWTCanvas`, the application will open and display a frame of the canvas shortly before freezing up completely without console output.
![](http://i.imgur.com/Pm1WDUI.png)
![](http://i.imgur.com/aUMUvP5.png)

data.title: Exception on linux running tests with external monitor
data.body:
I get this exception

``` java

Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglGraphics.setVSync(LwjglGraphics.java:510)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:118)
Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
    at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay.getAvailableDisplayModes(LinuxDisplay.java:954)
    at org.lwjgl.opengl.LinuxDisplay.init(LinuxDisplay.java:738)
    at org.lwjgl.opengl.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:138)
    ... 2 more

```

when running `LwjglTestStarter` on my laptop with an external monitor plugged in.

I have unplugged the monitor and used the laptop (built in) monitor and "randomly selected" tests seem to work as expected.

Extension:
https://github.com/TomGrill/gdx-facebook

Example App:
https://github.com/TomGrill/gdx-facebook-app

data.title: Smooth TemporalAction interruptions via SplineInterpolation
[FreeTypeFontGenerator] texture bleeding
data.body:
Hello

I render fonts produced with FreeTypeFontGenerator using Nearest filter and they look ugly:
![nearest](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1580663/10858083/8d7e91a4-7f52-11e5-8274-d5e37d37d167.png)

So I switch to Linear filter and they start to bleed. See this example with white text on white background, rotated 30°:
![bleed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1580663/10858108/c0fef83e-7f52-11e5-8cec-a3faf5187d7c.png)

In my humble opinion, to avoid bleeding FreeTypeFontGenerator should use RGB of the font color for glyph background.

data.title: [FreeTypeFontGenerator] should throw size=0 exception
[BitmapFont.java] rename "integer" flag to "useIntegerPositions"
data.body: It's a bit weird for a boolean variable to have name "integer".

data.title: Add Queue collection
data.body:
Adds a simple but efficient queue implementation.

**Motivation:**
`Array` is good for lists and stacks, but it is inefficient for building queues.

**Implementation:**
Queue is implemented as a java array with two indexes which rotate around, wrapping at the end. Details are documented in the code. All basic methods for queue manipulation are present (add/enqueue, remove/dequeue and peek). Queue can't overflow, grows when not enough space in the backing array. On underflow it returns null or specified default value, no exceptions are thrown.

PR includes unit test for the Queue.

data.title: BitmapFontCache created without the integer flag
ParticleEffect isComplete is true on continuous effects if delayTimer >= delay after update
VBO indexing GL_LINES style
data.body:
Say the vertices and indices indexing below, all while respecting the max of 32k vertices possible for a mesh:

![Image](http://s17.postimg.org/raq2q5167/verticesindices.png)

Couldn't we change the type of the indices array passed to the mesh from type short to int. Defining triangles with GL_LINES in VBO indexing style needs 5 indices per triangle and therefor quickly busts the indexes of a short[].

short: The short data type is a 16-bit signed two's complement integer. It has a minimum value of -32,768 and a maximum value of 32,767 (inclusive). 

32k vertices in this meshing fashion can create nearly ~ 32k triangles, indexing it needs 5 indices per triangle = 160k indices array size

Thanks for checking this,

data.title: Fix formatting
data.body: This PR fixes the extremely ugly formatting.

data.title: Shadow system 3 / 6.
data.body:
This commit refactor shadow system to be more consistent.
Moreover, it adds BaseShadowSystem which is the base for systems.

See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/3347

data.title: Libgdx Fatal JBullet Error, problematic file and frame
Bullet wrapper issue
Add isScrollingDisabled methods
data.body: Currently there isn't any way to check if scrolling in X/Y direction was disabled

data.title: AndroidMultiTouchHandler  ACTION_CANCEL issue
Corrected hitFraction bug in TriangleRaycastTest
data.body: MyTriangleRaycastCallback needs to find the lowest hitFraction. I assumed the super class handled this, but apparently it does not. The problem did not appear until I started experimenting with more complicated meshes.

data.title: Alternative PR for #3426
data.body:
A minimal alternative to PR number 3497. Keeps the enum names the same and adds just the new/missing devices.

Per discussion there with @xoppa @MobiDevelop.

Unfortunately I can't seem to build this to confirm myself, but I will happily (eagerly!) build from the next available nightly.

data.title: Corrected hitFraction bug in TriangleRaycastTest.
data.body: MyTriangleRaycastCallback needs to find the lowest hitFraction. I assumed the super class handled this, but apparently it does not. The problem did not appear until I started experimenting with more complicated meshes.

data.title: Can't get an object from JsonValue
fix misuse of glDeleteBuffer for glDeleteRenderBuffer in dispose
data.body: this error may cause some mistakes in rendering afterward

data.title: VerticalGroup does not let ScrollPane to scroll
black belt at the bottom of the screen - immersive mode, portrait mode, nexus device, android 6.0 bug
data.body:
I have found a bug in libgdx:
# Steps to reproduce
1. You have to have nexus device, that does have on screen buttons (tested on nexus 5 and nexus 9), device must be running Android 6.0 (app worked correctly in previous versions)
2. Create fresh new project (can be only andorid, no need for ios, desktop or html)
3. edit AndoridLauncher.java, add folowing comfig: `config.useImmersiveMode = true;` to enable "full screen mode"
4. Set app to be portrait rather than landscape (In AndoridManifest.xml, set: `android:screenOrientation="portrait"`)
5. Build & Deploy
6. Start app -> **App runs fine** -> _App runs fine only on first start_
7. Exit app by pressing back button twice
8. Start app again
9. There is **black belt at the bottom of the screen** as shown in screenshot)

![screenshot_20151022-083547](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15046120/10658606/d101e7ac-7898-11e5-952c-5a368b9f9e10.png)

Aditional info:
- belt can be removed by going out of the app and back into (middle button)
- belt can be removed by going to app switcher and back into the app
- our app is still in the development, therefore I cannot give you link to the play store to test it, but we have observed same problem with https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.freaxator.game100balls which presumably uses libgdx framework. 
- I have used latest gdx-setup.jar and latest LibGDX 1.7.0
# Logs

This is log of first startup (no black belt)

data.title: ScrollPane without backgroud cause wrong scissor
